stem: Angle M and angle R are supplementary. The measure of angle R is 5 times the measure of angle M. What is the measure of angle R in degrees?

A juice mixture contains 3/16 gallon of apple juice and 3/40 gallon of cranberry juice. How many gallons of apple juice per gallon of cranberry juice does the mixture contain? (Express your answer as a decimal.)

Mr. Chan’s lawn grows 2 1/8 inches every 2 weeks. He mows his lawn every 4 weeks and cuts off the top 2 1/4 inches of lawn. If Mr. Chan’s lawn was 3 inches tall at the beginning of the season, how many inches tall, in decimal form, is Mr. Chan’s lawn after 8 weeks?
The table above shows the number of children in each of 110 families. What is the median number of children in these families?

media.alt: Table showing number of families with 0,1,2,3,4 children: 45,32,19,8,6 respectively.

stem: Mr. Jones has 550 goats, which is 10% more than Mr. King has. How many more goats does Mr. Jones have than Mr. King?
If y ≠ 0 and y/x = x², what expression is represented by y / x²?

In the figure above, PQRS is a square. Point S is the center of the circle, and points P and R are on the circle. If the area of the square is 4 square centimeters, what is the area, in square centimeters, of the shaded quarter of the circle?

media.alt: Square PQRS with center S also center of a circle passing through P and R; quarter-circle shaded.

stem: A list of consecutive integers begins with m and ends with n. If n − m = 66, how many integers are in the list?
Simplify: (−x³⁹) ÷ (x³) + (x³⁹ ÷ 13)
Jar 1 and Jar 2 each contain 1/2 cup of water. If 1/4 of the water in Jar 1 is poured into Jar 2, how much water is now in Jar 2?
If n is a whole number and 0.01 is between 1/(n+1) and 1/n, what is the value of n?
When asked a certain question in a poll, 72% of the people polled answered yes. If 56 people did not answer yes to that question, what is the total number of people who were polled?

A museum has a room in the shape of a rectangle. The area of the floor is 960 square feet. In a scale drawing of the museum, 1 inch represents 20 feet. If the length of the room is 2 inches in the scale drawing, what is the width of the room in the scale drawing?

A program on a computer randomly generates a sequence of whole numbers from 1 to 9, inclusive. If the computer generates a sequence of 300 numbers, what is the best prediction of the number of odd numbers in the sequence?

A truck rental company charges a one-time fee of $40 plus $1 per mile driven. Dalia rented a truck and used a coupon for 20% off the total rental cost. After the coupon was applied, she spent a total of $60. How many miles did she drive?
The probability of drawing a red candy at random from a bag of 25 candies is 2/5. After 5 red candies are removed from the bag, what is the probability of randomly drawing a red candy from the bag?
Each number in a sequence is formed by doubling the previous number and then adding 1. If the 9th number in the sequence is 63, what is the 10th number minus the 7th number?

At a skating championship, there are seven judges who each award a score for each skater’s performance. The highest and lowest scores given to each skater are discarded, and the mean of the remaining scores is then calculated and reported as the skater’s final score. What is the final score for the skater who received the scores 8.9, 8.2, 8.5, 9.0, 8.4, 8.6, and 8.8?
A piece of wood that is 4 1/2 feet long is cut into 2 pieces of different lengths. The shorter piece has a length of x feet. Which inequality expresses all possible values of x?
What is the area, in square units, of the shaded region shown in the figure above?

media.alt: Graph with x- and y-axes showing shaded region in first quadrant.

stem: Yesterday in Centerville, the highest Fahrenheit temperature, F, was 86°, and the lowest was 68°. What was the difference between these temperatures, in degrees Celsius, C? (F = 9/5 C + 32)
Let x be an odd number. In terms of x, what is the sum of the two even numbers closest to x?

In 1991, the total public debt of the United States was about $3,600,000,000,000. In that year, there were about 250,000,000 people in the United States. Which amount is the best estimate of the public debt per person for that year?
In the figure above, N is the midpoint of MQ. Which segment has length (2y − x) centimeters?

media.alt: Segment MQ with midpoint N marked; other points M, P, Q labeled.

stem: What is the area of the parallelogram shown above?

media.alt: Parallelogram with base 30 ft and slant side 25 ft; height 20 ft.

stem: On Wednesday, a baker produced 100 more loaves of bread than were produced on Tuesday. On Thursday, the baker produced 50 fewer loaves than were produced on Tuesday. If the total number of loaves produced on all three days was 230, how many loaves were produced on Wednesday?
In the table above, what is the mean quiz score?

media.alt: Table of quiz scores in Mrs. Arch’s class: 9 students scored 60, 7 scored 70, 4 scored 80, 5 scored 90, and 3 scored 100.

stem: Which graph represents the solution to the inequality x + 4 ≥ 3?

media.alt: Four number line graphs showing shaded regions for different solution sets of x + 4 ≥ 3.

choices.text: Graph with shading to the right of x = −1
Graph with shading to the left of x = −1
Graph with shading to the right of x = 1
Graph with shading to the left of x = 1

stem: The reciprocal of 1/4 is added to the reciprocal of 3. What is the reciprocal of this sum?

Nura made a square poster with a side length of 13 inches. Latrice made a square poster with a side length of 15 inches. What is the difference, in square inches, between the area of Latrice’s poster and the area of Nura’s poster?
The table shows the cups of ingredients used to make 4 servings of oatmeal. What is the unit rate for cups of oats per cup of water?

media.alt: Ingredients table for 4 servings of oatmeal: oats 2 2/3 cups, water 3 1/4 cups.

stem: If (−3/5)x = 1/2, what is the value of x?
In a certain state, the sales tax rate increased from 7.0% to 7.5%. What was the increase in the sales tax on a $200 item?
The table above shows cell phone sales by color. What percent of the cell phones sold were blue?

media.alt: Cell phone sales by color: White = k+8, Black = 30, Blue = 30−2k, Red = k+5; Total = 100.

stem: On the number line above, the distance between X and Y is 1 unit, and the distance between Y and Z is 2 units. What is the distance between Y and the midpoint of X and Z?

media.alt: Number line with points X, Y, Z marked, distance XY = 1, YZ = 2.

stem: By what percent did the price of a cup of coffee increase if its price was increased from $1.25 to $1.35?

Raquel is cutting out pieces of cardboard to make a pyramid. She will use a square piece for the base and identical triangular pieces for the sides. The figure above shows the dimensions of the triangle for each side. What will be the total surface area, in square inches, of the pyramid, including the square base?

media.alt: Pyramid with square base and four triangular sides; triangle dimensions: two sides 13 in., base 10 in.

stem: The price of a sandwich was raised from $6.25 to $6.75. What was the percent increase in the price?
Terrell played 5 computer games and earned a mean score of 8 points per game. If his mean score for the first 4 games was 7 points per game, how many points was his score in the fifth game?
Lian bought enough oranges to fill 4 bags. Each bag contains 8 oranges. The total cost was $11.52. At that rate, how much would Lian pay for 42 oranges?
Compute: 3.6 ÷ 0.018

A tank with a 500-gallon capacity currently contains 75 gallons of water. Additional water is poured into this tank at a rate of 5 gallons per minute. After 45 minutes of adding water, what percentage of the tank’s total capacity will be filled? (Assume that there is no loss of water from the tank.)
Misha wants to use ribbon to make 2 straps for a backpack. The ribbon costs $5.00 a yard. If each strap requires 1 1/4 yards of ribbon, how much will Misha pay for the ribbon (not including tax)?

A graph shows the proportional relationship between the number of test questions a student gets correct, x, and the student’s test score, y. The ordered pair (1, 5/4) is on the graph. What does the y-coordinate of the ordered pair represent in this relationship?

choices.text: Each test question is worth 1 1/4 points.
An average student can answer 5 questions in 4 minutes.
A student who answers 5 questions correctly will earn 4 points.

stem: In a survey of 200 adults in the town of Waskegon, 45 reported reading the online version of the Waskegon Bulletin the previous day. If 25,000 adults live in Waskegon, which number is the best estimate of the number of adults who read the online version of the Waskegon Bulletin the previous day?
A hiker plans on hiking 17 miles in 3 days. Which equation describes the relationship between the number of days hiked, x, and the number of miles traveled, y?

Carolyn walked 3 miles from her house to the library and then 2 1/2 miles farther to the grocery store. Returning home by the same route, she walked 1 2/3 miles before stopping at a friend’s house. How many miles did Carolyn have left to walk home?
A child grows 1 1/4 inches in 1/3 of a year. What would be his yearly growth rate in inches per year?
Carlos has $350 in a savings account that earns 5% simple interest each year. How much will he have in the account after 1 year, if there is no money withdrawn?
The probability of an event occurring is 0.05. What is the chance that the event will occur?

The table below shows the number of cups of red paint and blue paint used to make a purple paint mixture. Based on the relationship between the number of cups of red paint and the number of cups of blue paint, what is the value of y?

media.alt: Table showing cups of red and blue paint: (1, 1.5), (4, 6), (11, y).

stem: On the number line above, what is the distance, in units, between the midpoint of PQ and the midpoint of QR?

media.alt: Number line with points P, Q, R marked at positions −3, 2, and 7.

stem: An ice cream shop sells 16 cups of ice cream for $48 and 4 cups for $12. There is a proportional relationship between the number of cups of ice cream and the cost. What is the constant of proportionality for this relationship?
